title: Subbase
summary: In topology, a subbase (or subbasis, prebase, prebasis) for a topological space X {\displaystyle X} with topology τ {\displaystyle \tau } is a subcollection B {\displaystyle B} of τ {\displaystyle \tau } that generates τ , {\displaystyle \tau ,} in the sense that τ {\displaystyle \tau } is the smallest topology containing B {\displaystyle B} as open sets. A slightly different definition is used by some authors, and there are other useful equivalent formulations of the definition; these are discussed below.
